node.display_long_description:
A cooperative and chaotic party game that requires you to shout technobabble at your friends! Play with people on mobile/tablet and with other VR players online. You can also shout at yourself in practice mode. 

Attempt to follow randomly generated, incorrectly assigned instructions.

If your Spaceteam can complete enough instructions successfully in a sector you will progress to the next, each sector becomes increasingly difficult and as the ship becomes harder to control!

FULL VR MULTIPLAYER
Up to 6 players, connected to the internet, in any popular VR headset join in a coop game of trying to avoid their binding doom.

FACE TO FACE
Up to 6 players locally with at least one headset and connected smart devices, this offers an experience much like the original Spaceteam game.

SINGLE PLAYER
In Practice Mode you will join 2 of our trusty robots!

And remember to work together… as a Spaceteam!

nodes.title: Birthday Celebrations!
nodes.body_text:
Greetings Space Cadets!

It's been a pretty wild year for all, so it might come as a shock that it's an entire year since Spaceteam VR released on Oculus.

To celebrate our birthday, we've added some new cosmetic goodies for our intrepid crews.

From 1 am PDT on Friday, May 21st, every player who logs in before the end of Monday 24th will unlock a cool pair of X-Ray Glasses to equip your avatar. Playing in a multiplayer game will unlock our new Black/Pink uniform combo, and for any players who reach sector 5 (it's really quite easy), you will unlock our Orange/White Commander's Uniform. Once unlocked, these are yours to keep!

As an added bonus, all players will also have access to our new playable alien species, pictured below. You will be able to select this look from May 21st onwards, even if you don't manage to make it to our birthday weekend event.

Balloons!

We've added some party balloons around the bridge of the ship, just to mark the occasion.

Keep your eyes open for some exciting announcements coming from the Spaceteam Crew over the next few days - we have lots to talk about in the very near future!

See you on the bridge, and remember.......... work together as a space team!

nodes.title: New Years (Bug) Resolutions!
nodes.body_text:
Oculus Quest
- Added an option for selecting refresh rate on Quest 2

General
- Keep an eye out for ‘News Available’ notifications about our upcoming updates!

Bug Fixes
- Fixed a bug that caused joining via code to place players in the wrong game
- Fixed a bug that would allow players to join a game after it had started
- Fixed a bug where the user could be pushed back by the in-game menu
- Fixed a bug that caused the “public game” notification to appear for private games


Thank you for playing and please leave a review if you're enjoying the game and if not please get in touch with us!

Also please remember to join us on Thursday and Saturday's for our regular events!

node.reviewDescription:
The game is fun and the new VR game play elements are very nice additions. I was a fan of the game in the iPhone and when I saw it on the quest and got it and offered it to two friends. I have 4 starts because quite a lot le time is wasted getting everyone to be able to eat each other so we can play and it’s only in English. 

Alas it’s still better on iOS because there it’s available in many language. I can play in English but French is my 1st language and the iOS French version is sooooo hilarious. 
Developers please translate tout game on the Qu’este too

developerResponse.body:
Hi there. Thanks for playing Spaceteam VR and leaving a review.

We're delighted to announce that localisation is coming soon. Most of the work on our end is already done. However, we have a couple of updates in the works which add new content and some minor UI updates, so we're in the process of having those extra phrases localised. Once all of these updates come together, we'll be able to launch them with localisation.

website_page_meta.description: A cooperative and chaotic party game that requires you to shout technobabble at your friends! You need to work together… as a Spaceteam!
website_page_meta.title: Spaceteam VR · Oculus Quest
